perturbation.original_text:
ARTICLE V WARRANTY

5.01.  Products Warranty. Company warrants that Distributor shall acquire Products purchased hereunder free and clear of all liens and encumbrances except for Company's purchase money security interest defined in Section 1.03, above. Company further warrants all Products to be free from defects in material or workmanship under normal use and service for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of delivery. Any defects must be replaced by the Company within sixty (60) days within this scope of the warranty and all charges for labor and material, will be borne by Company. If it is determined that either no fault exists in Company, or the damage was caused by negligence of Distributor, its agents, employees or customers, Distributor agrees to pay all charges associated with each such replacement. THIS CONSTITUTES THE SOLE WARRANTY MADE BY COMPANY EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED. THERE ARE NO OTHER WARRANTIES EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED WHICH EXTEND BEYOND THE FACE HEREOF, HEREIN, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. IN NO EVENT SHALL COMPANY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES AND DISTRIBUTOR'S REMEDIES SHALL BE LIMITED TO REPAIR OR REPLACEMENT OF NONCONFORMING UNITS OR PARTS.       2
perturbation.changed_text:
ARTICLE II MARKETING AND SUPPORT

2.01.  Sales. Distributor shall use commercially reasonable efforts to market, distribute and promote the Brand and Products in the Territory at its own cost.  Company warrants that Distributor shall acquire Products purchased hereunder free and clear of all liens and encumbrances except for Company's purchase money security interest defined in Section 1.03, above. Company further warrants all Products to be free from defects in material or workmanship under normal use and service for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of delivery. Any defects must be replaced by the Company within sixty (60) days within this scope of the warranty and all charges for labor and material, will be borne by Company. If it is determined that either no fault exists in Company, or the damage was caused by negligence of Distributor, its agents, employees or customers, Distributor agrees to pay all charges associated with each such replacement. THIS CONSTITUTES THE SOLE WARRANTY MADE BY COMPANY EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED. THERE ARE NO OTHER WARRANTIES EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED WHICH EXTEND BEYOND THE FACE HEREOF, HEREIN, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. IN NO EVENT SHALL COMPANY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES AND DISTRIBUTOR'S REMEDIES SHALL BE LIMITED TO REPAIR OR REPLACEMENT OF NONCONFORMING UNITS OR PARTS.
perturbation.explanation: The product warranty is moved to the Marketing and Support section, where it is less likely to be noticed by a party reviewing the contract for warranty information. Warranty information should be clearly and prominently disclosed in a section dedicated to warranties, not buried within marketing clauses.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC), which requires clear and conspicuous warranty disclaimers.

perturbation.original_text: 9.05.  Applicable Law. This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of Texas.  All payments hereunder shall be made at Company's offices at Frisco, Texas.  Company's rights granted hereby are cumulative and in addition to any rights it may have at law or equity.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.05.  Applicable Law. All payments hereunder shall be made at Company's offices at Frisco, Texas.  Company's rights granted hereby are cumulative and in addition to any rights it may have at law or equity. This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of a state mutually agreed upon by both parties at the time of any dispute.
perturbation.explanation: The alteration adds a contradictory statement that the applicable law will be determined by mutual agreement at the time of a dispute. This contradicts the original clause which explicitly states that Texas law governs the agreement. This creates uncertainty and could lead to legal challenges regarding which jurisdiction's laws apply.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic principles of contract law, which require clear and unambiguous terms, including the governing law.

perturbation.original_text: 3.03.  Cancellation. Distributor may, at any time prior to the scheduled date of shipment, cancel any or all Products on order upon giving timely written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.03.  Cancellation. Distributor may, at any time prior to the scheduled date of shipment, cancel any or all Products on order upon giving timely written notice. However, if the products are custom-made, the company reserves the right to refuse cancelation without explanation.
perturbation.explanation: The new part of the cancellation clause is a contradiction, because it lets the company cancel without explanation. If that were the case then there would be no ability to cancel from the distributor.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic principles of contract law, which require that clauses be clear and consise.
